website_summaries.verdict: The best umbrella holder if you want simple functionality over great looks. Best budget option due to the practical organization it offers.
pros: Extra-wide profile with separate dividers keeps five individual umbrellas organized without tangling
Easy to put umbrellas in and take them out on the go
cons: Wider profile requires more space than other umbrella holders

customer_reviews.title: Not just for umbrellas!
customer_reviews.text: I love this stand! It is weighted with cast iron so it doesn’t tip over as I use it to place all of my cat’s wand toys in. It keeps things tidy and organized, instead of various wands all over the floor. And the real bonus is, the wands are standing up, stick side down into the slots so the ribbons, feathers and other dangling ‘toy’ portions of the wands are in a position where my cats can play with the dangling bits on their own, as well, without knocking over the stand. High quality item, would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tilly Lace

customer_reviews.title: Minimal use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to fit compactly behind an open door. It does just that perfectly well. It’s a substantial weight, unobtrusive and smart looking. However... rubber cane tips have trouble being inserted and canes or tall umbrellas are a bit unwieldy for the height of the stand and tend to pull it over since roughly 70% of the weight is at the top. This will also not fit inverted or compact umbrella widths easily. I’ll be looking for a more substantial and generous holder in the future. This one requires too much precision and care to place or remove a cane or umbrella without knocking it over.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopping

customer_reviews.title: I'm Amazed at How Useful This Thing Is!
customer_reviews.text: This "umbrella stand" is a real find! I was looking for a stand to hold walking canes and it turns out that this works wonderfully for my intended purpose. In addition to umbrellas and canes, it holds mops and brooms and yard sticks and all kinds of stuff. It's very compact (taking up a tiny footprint so you can tuck it along a wall or in a corner) and sturdy and the price is amazingly low. I just went back to Amazon and bought another one! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Wanda Hoofnagle

customer_reviews.title: Great space and sanity saver!
customer_reviews.text: I put this on our landing in a space between two doors. Both doors can be opened plenty wide enough without hitting it, which a normal round umbrella stand would not have allowed. It's currently holding 3 extra large "doorman" sized umbrellas just fine.
customer_reviews.author: C. Abbey

customer_reviews.title: Small but sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for an awkward spot behind my front door. I was surprised at how tiny it was when I received it, but it works great! I have several large golf umbrellas and a couple kids' umbrellas in it and it is sturdy as ever. The umbrellas have never tipped and the water pools up the the little wells at the base. I am very impressed. Good things do come in small packages. :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty, does what it says.
customer_reviews.text: We use for umbrellas. Never put one back wet as not knowing if cast iron would rust. Bought a return for a few bucks less, perfect condition (inner box pretty bad, taped but no big deal.) Not a piece of art but love slim line. Nice for tight areas. We do have against a wall with 3 umbrellas (5 holes)
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Little wonder!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked this guy, very very discrete and minimalist. Super functional and it is much smaller than it feels in the pictures. Works great!!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Little stand, but works well
customer_reviews.text: I didn't think this would work, but it does. It's actually quite small, but very heavy and stable, at least in the garage. I can see some stability issues with this if you use it on carpet. Even though it is small, it can even hold my big golf umbrellas. I like that it is so streamlined as it doesn't take up much space. It easily sits against the wall by the door, safely holding my umbrellas.
customer_reviews.author: Eric L

customer_reviews.title: For those who are afraid that the holes won't fit, I'll provide the dimensions
customer_reviews.text: Here are the dimensions of one hole: 2.75" x 1.5". You can see it yourself if your item will fit. I have a golf umbrella and it fits perfectly. The stand is strong so there is no fear of toppling. The little well under holds dripping water.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic solution for tight space
customer_reviews.text: This small holder is heavy and will keep umbrellas and walking sticks upright. I use it in a tight space next to a shoe rack in the entrance of the house. It is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this in a very small space in my laundry/mud room. It's really heavy and sturdy. If fits great between the wall and my washer. And it's out of sight but does the job great for the rainy days when I'm heading out the door for walks with my dog!
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Great Umbrella Holder
customer_reviews.text: Love this umbrella holder. Its heavy, so it doesnt tip over. Holds small and large umbrellas. Doesnt take up much room, which is great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: Much smaller than expected, but it does what I need it to do, hold umbrellas...
customer_reviews.author: RealDeal

customer_reviews.title: sleek design
customer_reviews.text: Lovely, modern, functional, and heavy weight so it won't knock over.
customer_reviews.author: c

customer_reviews.title: Interesting design, but there are flaws
customer_reviews.text: While it is attractive in appearance, it is much smaller than expected. It would be better if the base were heavier, thus less likely to tip over. The holes are not big enough to accommodate a collapsible umbrella. Some people do not know what it is, so we've had to make a label for it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Levy

customer_reviews.title: Very small but power packed
customer_reviews.text: We ordered one umbrella stand not noticing its small size. When it came we were really surprised. It is small. But it held our umbrellas--even the big golf umbrellas. We liked it so well we bought a second to store canes. Just watch this item because the price flucutes throughout the day.
customer_reviews.author: MaggieMay

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, doesn’t tip, great behind door.
customer_reviews.text: Very heavyweight, doesn’t tip with weight if wet umbrellas. Narrow, fits perfectly behind by back door without impeding or blocking the door at all. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Jorgensen

customer_reviews.title: Great design
customer_reviews.text: I love the umbrella stand because it doesn't take up a lot of space, holds umbrellas and walking sticks alike and doesn't just fall over due to its heavy weight. I put it next to my Oceanstar Bamboo Shoe Racks and it is just about as wide, so it fits perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: hobbit

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold more than 2 umbrellas without toppling
customer_reviews.text: On Amazon it says " Stable design - 5 lb. cast iron base keeps umbrellas upright and won’t topple over." Well, this stand immediately topples over as soon as I put more than 2 umbrellas in it!
customer_reviews.author: NG

customer_reviews.title: Great for small spaces!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little umbrella stand! It fits perfectly right inside the door behind our storage bench. We have 3 different sizes of umbrellas in it and they all fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Work great inside and out
customer_reviews.text: These guys are da bomb! I have one at multiple entrances to our house. The work great inside and out, and double as effective doorstops.
customer_reviews.author: Rob McMillin

customer_reviews.title: It is a perfect fit for the space I put it in
customer_reviews.text: This Polder Slimline Umbrella Stand was just what I needed! It is a perfect fit for the space I put it in. Thank you so much. I highly reccommend this product for small spaces. Carolyn Smith
customer_reviews.author: Carolyn F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to hold my tailoring rulers which range in various sizes and shapes. It holds them with no danger of tilting or tipping over. The rulers are usually awkward to store and access. Now they stand upright, organized, and I can easily grab one without sorting through the others.
customer_reviews.author: Beezus

customer_reviews.title: excellent display stand for canes
customer_reviews.text: the criticisms of this item as an umbrella stand are probably valid; however, its weight and low profile make for a great way to display up to five canes. I have mine up against a wall so tipping over is not an issue. They line up nicely, and the stand adds, not detracts from the overall appearance.
customer_reviews.author: rb.sr

customer_reviews.title: A nice compact solution.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with this product. I like it as umbrellas can drain into the base, provided some of the excess water is shaken off, also air can circulate around them as they're drying. A nice compact solution. It is best to have the long side against a wall if storing large umbrellas, see image.
customer_reviews.author: Inge Buchanan

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and study!
customer_reviews.text: This sturdy unbrella stand is very space-conscious. Fits in very crowded or small areas--reduces the hazards of tripping over something much larger. I highly recommend this stand.
customer_reviews.author: WingNut

customer_reviews.title: Marginal, at best
customer_reviews.text: Likes to fall over when 2 or 3 umbrellas are put in it. It needs anchored
customer_reviews.author: pastor rich

customer_reviews.title: The Best!!
customer_reviews.text: This umbrella stand is great. Cast iron and won't topple over. Heavy and very sturdy. I have 4 large golf umbrellas and they fit. Room for 1 more. Great for a small space. You won't be sorry if you order it.
customer_reviews.author: L. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small condo and this is great for my umbrellas and walking sticks in the entry area.
customer_reviews.author: Beth F

customer_reviews.title: exactly what we needed
customer_reviews.text: we bot this b/c we got tired of our umbrellas falling over in the coat closet but we didn't have room for a round umbrella stand - this fits perfectly against the wall and holds even large bulky umbrellas
customer_reviews.author: pandm

customer_reviews.title: Great for thin umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for use at the resort I work at. We have umbrellas for guest use which are thin - this holds them perfectly, and doesn't take up much space. However, some guests bring their own umbrellas, and this stand won't hold everything. If you look at the base in the picture, those "pits" hold the tops of the umbrella. This means the umbrella needs the pointy bit on top (called a Ferrule, according to Wikipedia - who knew?!) to stand up correctly. If that's your umbrellas, this stand will work well. It does not tip over, either.
customer_reviews.author: N. J. Steere

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great Cane stand
customer_reviews.text: I am using it to hold my many canes. It fit down in a pretty basket—so you don't see the stand, just the basket. It does a great job, takes up very little room, and is very reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: deb

customer_reviews.title: Great size.
customer_reviews.text: The size is perfect for behind my front door. It holds my large umbrellas and even my flag pole. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jacque Brister

customer_reviews.title: brooms and other cleaning items but it heavy and sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: My only wish is that it was about 3 inches taller since I am using it for a place to store my, umbrella, brooms and other cleaning items but it heavy and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: barbtruesdell

customer_reviews.title: Heavy
customer_reviews.text: We have our work umbrellas in this and it doesn't tip over or have any problems. I do recommend that you get a tray for underneath if you live in a area where the umbrellas get soaked. Like Seattle-
customer_reviews.author: Sheri Beckerman

customer_reviews.title: Good for small spaces.
customer_reviews.text: Too small. Might be good for a small apartment space but did not look right in a house entry way. Also a very basic metal material that did not fit in with my decor.
customer_reviews.author: Marina M

customer_reviews.title: It's merely okay.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say, this purchase has been disappointing. The stand should be kept against a wall, because it tips easily. Be careful to check if there's water in the base--it rusts a bit. And only certain umbrellas will fit in it.
customer_reviews.author: JH&RG

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits perfectly outside on our landing. NO more wet umbrellas in the house:)
customer_reviews.author: D. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: I don't love this product
customer_reviews.text: I don't love this product. While the base is pretty heavy, it still tips over when all of the umbrella slots are full. I could have spent less money on a better product.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley L

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for full size umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: It will not fit compact umbrellas, but I keep those in the car anyway. This is very slim and heavy so it won't tip over but it doesn't take up much floor space at all. We have it right next to the front door and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy and sturdy but so much shorter than i realized
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy and sturdy but so much shorter than i realized. That's the only reason it's not getting a 5 from me. It's a little tippy with tall items in it.
customer_reviews.author: Thrifty

customer_reviews.title: easy to move and hold plenty
customer_reviews.text: purchased for church hall, easy to move and hold plenty
customer_reviews.author: Christi

customer_reviews.title: Small but effective. I actually use it for my ...
customer_reviews.text: Small but effective. I actually use it for my cane so it won't fall over next to my desk. Does not take up any real space.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth C. Olliff

customer_reviews.title: perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed in my narrow entry. It takes up little room and provides a much needed service.
customer_reviews.author: resistant ♏rev.i 🔯⛎ew Uer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Product
customer_reviews.text: Great product for all my big umbrellas! It's simple design fits any decor and there is no assembly. I would definely recommend this to others.
customer_reviews.author: Linda D. Jansen

customer_reviews.title: Umbrella stand
customer_reviews.text: Great! We love it. It fits perfectly behind our kitchen door,, out of the way but convenient just need to paint it.
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't take up too much space, it blends in to the environment well, its ergonomically convienient, sturdy, and it works great for my purpose of showing off a couple of hand carved canes next to my front door. Plus I have the spare slots for wet umbrellas and visitors. both the fit for my need and the price was right, ergo 5 stars and my reccomendation to others.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Leone

customer_reviews.title: Not for golf umbrellas!
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly not for golf umbrellas, & perhaps only for compact umbrellas. There is not enough weight at the bottom to keep tall umbrellas from tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Extremely satisfied
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect. It is sturdy and as the umbrella stand is not the focal point in my entryway works perfectly. Very good quality and a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The umbrellas don't stand up. The whole stand tips over.
customer_reviews.author: miriam osdoba

customer_reviews.title: Holes small and topples
customer_reviews.text: The spaces really are too small for all but the thinnest of umbrellas. I also found it toppling over often if kept outside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: small, but works
customer_reviews.text: Should have read the description more carefully. This is very small. When empty, people would have no idea what it is. I need to put an umbrella in it and leave it there so others know what it is. Will make a good doorstop since it's got some weight to it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan G.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and well made
customer_reviews.text: This stand is sturdy and well made. It is solid cast iron and has enough weight to keep it from falling over. Check the dimensions - it is not huge. The top of the umbrella has just enough room to hold the umbrella.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy product
customer_reviews.text: Love this umbrella stand!!! Used it for at least half a year and very much pleased with it. Organizes my umbrellas and keeps them neatly out of the way!
customer_reviews.author: Dan Dashevskiy

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: It's slim and takes little room although it's heavy enough to hold 5 tall umbrellas without tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for NYC apartments.  Can only use standard straight umbrellas.
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say here except that it is the ideal umbrella hold that I've been looking for my NYC apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Jdq1223

customer_reviews.title: Perfect umbrella stand for kitchen door area
customer_reviews.text: Holds my regular umbrella, flag pole, and a couple of brooms by the back door of my very small kitchen. Perfect for my needs!
customer_reviews.author: Dagensblommor

customer_reviews.title: Can't go wrong with cast iron
customer_reviews.text: This truly is slim and i'm suddenly undecided on which corner of the garage it'll go. It's also heavy enough to keep golf umbrellas upright. And when the umbrella's dripping wet, the bottom is designed to collect/catch the water.
customer_reviews.author: CloudStorage

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and space-saving!
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small studio apartment and am very particular about the items I buy that I know I'll be looking at all the time. This umbrella stand made great sense to me; it's got a TINY footprint and holds umbrellas just fine. I have a full-sized umbrella - no complaints on how it works for me. I can see if you had a small, compact umbrella, this probably wouldn't work well, but I personally don't like those type umbrellas. It's made of cast iron so it's not tipping over, that is for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Lorelai

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Stand was bent, slots on top did not line up with holes on bottom.
customer_reviews.author: Ulysses Lima

customer_reviews.title: More than...
customer_reviews.text: Great, sturdy product. I bought two and use them at our church for praise flag stands! They acre compact, and the draping of the flags over them look wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: onemeiam

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and functional
customer_reviews.text: I have it against a corner in my closet, but my umbrellas stand up perfectly in it (without leaning on the wall). Haven't tried standing a golf umbrella in it yet, perhaps that's what was tipping this for other people. I love the slim profile, it makes everything look neat!
customer_reviews.author: Hello World

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size
customer_reviews.text: i needed something small to fit a tight space but still sturdy. this item is absolutely perfect. fit like a glove
customer_reviews.author: Anna M. Pizzo

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to hanging brooms et al of a wall
customer_reviews.text: Using this instead of wall pins to hang brooms and other sticks. If you stand this in a corner it does the job exceptionally well and given how tiny it is, does not bring about any visual clutter.
customer_reviews.author: A. Com

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty and serves it's purpose. Not very attractive though. Don't really want it in my entry way.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: compact & sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I like it so far. Not sure if it will rust when wet put and outside in the rainy season though.
customer_reviews.author: cw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to hold my collection of massage sticks. I thought an umbrella stand might work, but I didn't want anything too elaborate. The Slimline Umbrella Stand is perfect. It is small and unobtrusive, but very solid. Now my sticks are stored nicely and don't keep falling over anymore. My husband was impressed with how well the Slimline worked too.
customer_reviews.author: EMM

customer_reviews.title: Use it to hold kitchen stuff too
customer_reviews.text: This worked ok as an umbrella holder until I got a bigger coat rack/holder as a gift. My wife being the awesome person she is, re-purposed this in the kitchen to hold cooking spoons. It takes up a lot less space than the typical bowl of "stuff". Only downside is the handles have to be long enough. Easy enough to paint it any color you want if the industrial grey isn't your thing.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Andersen

customer_reviews.title: Too small...falls over.
customer_reviews.text: This works with little short folding type umbrellas, but not any normal sized ones. I could only get it to work if put 2 or 4 in it and leaned them left...right...left...right to offset each other. It just needs to be a lot bigger. I'd want it to be three times it's current size. It is only 9 inches tall, while my umbrella is about 40 inches.
customer_reviews.author: THOMAS A HIDAY

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, needs anchor support
customer_reviews.text: They should sell this with an anchor support you could attach to a stud in the wall. It falls over when loaded with one or two let alone when it's full of umbrellas. If you are willing to figure out your own way to attach it to the wall or anchor it down, it's a great stand.
customer_reviews.author: M. Dawson

customer_reviews.title: Solid, well-designed piece
customer_reviews.text: Perfect way to store your umbrellas and such. I put two together for additional convenience. These are rock solid, so taller umbrellas fit just fine and won’t fall over. The material is high quality and the finish is nicely applied.
customer_reviews.author: GAR

customer_reviews.title: Serves our Purpose
customer_reviews.text: We needed an umbrella stand that didn't take up too much room as we use it near our back door. When it is raining, we take our dogs out while holding umbrellas and stand over them while they do their business. Yes, our dogs are spoiled. This stand worked well. It holds several umbrellas including a large golf one. (One of our dogs is half Great Dane.) It doesn't fall over and takes up so little area. Maybe not the most attractive umbrella holder, but certainly serves our purpose.
customer_reviews.author: SpaceMom125

customer_reviews.title: Good only for compact collapsible umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for an umbrella stand for the mud room and happened across this product, which looked appealing because of its compact and minimalist nature. The good: it's compact and minimalist, but heavy enough not to tip over easily. The bad: It's very short and doesn't work well for tall umbrellas, and the slots are small enough that only slim umbrellas fit into it. I thought about returning it, but since we own a mix of compact collapsable umbrellas and gigantic windproof golf umbrellas, we decided to keep this for the compact ones and find a traditional umbrella holder for the golf umbrellas.
customer_reviews.author: M. Landau

customer_reviews.title: Forget Umbrellas, think brooms
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to keep the stuff in my broom cupboard tidy. It takes those messy tubes from the vacuum cleaner and some brooms, etc and keeps them organized. The holes are rather small for an umbrella, but suit cleaning stuff perfectly as two things go in one of the slots. Highly recommended for this purpose, and I plan to get more.
customer_reviews.author: Book Freak

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice and heavy I'm currently useing it to organize flag poles
customer_reviews.author: Anastasia

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to use as a stand for my walking canes. The problem is with the bottom slots which are not large enough to accommodate the rubber cane tips. Other than that it is a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Mobley

customer_reviews.title: A mini stand for (dry) mini umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: There are not alot of options on Amazon for umbrella stands, so despite other cautionary reviews, I ordered it. It is well made, but too darn small to be effective. That is, when I come in from the rain, I want a place to put the wet umbrella, and this stand is not it; once dry I can put or hang the umbrella anywhere. I will pay the shipping for the return (even though the openings are small, if the stand were taller I might keep it to organize other objects like the yardstick one reviewer mentioned, or dowels).
customer_reviews.author: MeyerMan

customer_reviews.title: I am still delighted with it
customer_reviews.text: As other reviewers noted, this stand is too short for anything but short umbrellas. HOWEVER, I am still delighted with it. The quality and design (except for being too short) are excellent. The price is great. If it were 3-5 inches taller it would definitely be five stars. (I am able to be tolerant because the space for which I needed it (narrow and near a wall) allows the taller umbrellas leaning space.)
customer_reviews.author: Marioneve

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. Has weight to it to prevent from tipping over. Correct size to place near my front door.
customer_reviews.author: A T

customer_reviews.title: It works for what I bought it for.. ...
customer_reviews.text: It works for what I bought it for...to store my broom and mop in a small area; it's somewhat heavy and has a quality appearance..
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Good stand for regular "slim" umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: Good, and study umbrella stand. Weighted so it won't topple over when you put your umbrellas in. Be warned though, it is small! It will NOT fit the smaller "fat" compact umbrellas.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Ford

customer_reviews.title: Serves it's purpose ...
customer_reviews.text: It's the only option I could find for a small space but I would recommend you fasten it to a wall if possible as it does fall over now and then. Otherwise, it's pretty sturdy and serves it's purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Solid - Heavy - Well Built - Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is an AWESOME umbrella holder. It's heavy and sturdy and small, but the perfect size to hold any umbrella. I was worried that maybe umbrellas would tip the device over at full capacity - but not with this because of the weight of the device. I highly recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: Maher Daoudi

customer_reviews.title: At Little Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: This stand is a lot smaller than even I imagined. It works okay where I am using it. I guess it is sturdy enough but it really isn't made for the over sized umbrellas that I own. It works well for the standard size ones but the larger umbrellas don't stand in it as well.
customer_reviews.author: MRK

customer_reviews.title: Mop/broom holder
customer_reviews.text: I use this to keep my mops and brooms in place in the garage. It's nicely weighted and sturdy, but the price is high for what it is, in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: DeeD.

customer_reviews.title: Small but Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Small but sturdy. The weighted base holds up nicely and the low profile makes this perfect for putting behind our front door so that umbrellas are out of the way until they're needed.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: This item is perfect for its intended use
customer_reviews.text: This item is perfect for its intended use. It is sturdy, small and easy to keep behim a door or in a corner.
customer_reviews.author: Abigdogmom

customer_reviews.title: Tips easily on carpet, but better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: This tips over pretty easily on carpet. I use it for all of my kids foam swords in their room. It definitely looks nicer than swords strewn across the house.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Toppled over immediately
customer_reviews.text: Got the item out of the box and put 3 umbrellas in the stand and it toppled over immediately! At this point the only way to maintain its stability is to lean the umbrella against a wall which defeats the purpose of buying the umbrella stand in the first place. This issue will lead to water dripping down the wall which is what I was trying to avoid. Still trying to determine if it is worth returning since I didn't get any shipping paperwork with the product for returning. Do Not suggest this product as it is not tall enough to get a hold on the umbrellas and therefore maintain it's stability. Good Luck!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn  Boyle

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Does a great job of organizing umbrellas in a limited space.
customer_reviews.author: Marty

customer_reviews.title: You won't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Awesome. Compact. I Keep it behind my front door with no issues. I have four tall umbrellas in it and it has never fallen over once.
customer_reviews.author: thinkOUTside

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: This product is VERY tiny and if you have pop-up umbrellas they Do Not fit!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very lightweight & low to the ground
customer_reviews.text: Good design, but it's so short that it needs to sit against a wall or the umbrellas will tip it over.
customer_reviews.author: IS

customer_reviews.title: Great for long umbrellas - won't work for short ones
customer_reviews.text: Cool for long umbrellas but won't hold the short ones. The slots are too small for compact umbrellas
customer_reviews.author: Eric G.

customer_reviews.title: Clever design
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. This is a small unit that fits easily behind a door. We put umbrellas and walking sticks in it.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret

customer_reviews.title: Lofty idea.
customer_reviews.text: Nice and sturdy. Looks great in industrial chic loft decor.
customer_reviews.author: bluwiz

customer_reviews.title: Good, but rusts easily
customer_reviews.text: The bottom rusts quite easily when you put a wet umbrella in it.
customer_reviews.author: Anne Triplett

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow to hold compact umbrellas
customer_reviews.text: These looks great and have a heavy and sturdy base but the holes are too small for compact umbrellas. Basically, if you make an "O" with your fingers and the umbrella can't fit thru, then it won't fit into the holes on the stand either. I kept these anyway for guests with slim umbrellas.
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Unstable - Prone to toppling. Rusts.
customer_reviews.text: Unstable when using with taller umbrellas and prone to toppling over, and the unit rusts after collecting rainwater drip.
customer_reviews.author: V MULLA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very cute and does not take up any space. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Josephine Pough

product_meta.title: Polder Slimline Umbrella Stand Black
product_meta.description:
Store your wet umbrellas in this convenient and practical Polder Slimline Umbrella Stand. An ultra thin profile neatly holds up to 5 umbrellas and keeps the floors dry with the built in bottom tray. A 5 lb. cast-iron base keeps umbrellas upright and won’t topple over. Polder Solves Problems…We are the solutions resource, making items for everyday living throughout the home. We focus on taking universal daily tasks, studying and applying our user-centered design philosophy to create products that are useful, beautiful and better. Whether it’s kitchen prep & storage, home organization & laundry or personal care items, we are passionate about products, design and the evolution of how people use products in the home every day. We’re also about quality and customer satisfaction and work to make items that last and perform to deliver on their intended promise. Polder…life.style.solutions.
